channel.title: Alva J. K. Markelius
channel.description: Recent content on Alva J. K. Markelius

item.description:
About

I am a PhD candidate and Cambridge Trust Scholar at the Affective Intelligence and Robotics Laboratory (AFAR), Department of Computer Science & Technology, University of Cambridge, and recipient of the Top 100 Brilliant Women in AI Ethics™ award 2024. I currently serve as committee chair of the Centre for Human-Inspired AI Early Career Community and as student steward for Better Images of AI.

Polo

I am currently serving as Co-President of the Cambridge University Polo Club and train and compete actively across the UK and abroad.

Summer varsity 2025, on Aurora

Projects

Current Projects

Social Robots & Disability

Stakeholder Perspectives on Whether and How Technology, AI and Robots Can Help for Mediation and Advocacy for Students with Disabilities

Publications

Journal Papers

  • Markelius, A., Bailey, J., Gibson, J. L., & Gunes, H. (2025). Stakeholder Perspectives on Whether and How Social Robots Can Support Mediation and Advocacy for Higher Education Students with Disabilities. arXiv preprint arXiv:2503.16499 [arXiv]
  • Markelius, A. (2025). An Empirical Design Justice Approach to Identifying Ethical Considerations in the Intersection of Large Language Models and Social Robotics. In P. Hacker (Ed.), Oxford Intersections: AI in Society. Oxford Academic [DOI]
  • Markelius, A., & Gunes, H. (2025). Social Robotics and Large Language Models for Disability: A Scoping Review. PREPRINT, Research Square [DOI]
  • Rutar, D., Markelius, A., Cheke, L. G., & Hernández-Orallo, J. (2025). Cognitive Science-Inspired Evaluation of Core Capabilities for Object Understanding in AI. arXiv preprint arXiv:2503.21668 [DOI]
  • Ravandi, B. S., Khan, I., Markelius, A., Bergström, M., Gander, P., Erzin, E., & Lowe, R. (2025). Exploring task and social engagement in companion social robots: a comparative analysis of feedback types. Advanced Robotics [DOI]
  • Rutar, D., Markelius, A., Schellaert, W., Hernández-Orallo, J., & Cheke, L. (2025). General interaction battery: Simple object navigation and affordances (GIBSONA). Cognitive Systems Research [DOI]
  • Vivas, A. B., Estévez, A. F., Khan, I., Roldán-Tapia, L., Markelius, A., Nielsen, S., & Lowe, R. (2024). DigiDOP: A framework for applying digital technology to the Differential Outcomes Procedure. Neuroscience & Biobehavioral Reviews [DOI]
  • Markelius, A., Wright, C., Kuiper, J., Delille, N., & Kuo, Y. T. (2024). The Mechanisms of AI Hype and its Planetary and Social Costs. AI & Ethics [DOI]
  • Markelius, A., Sjöberg, S., Bergström, M., Ravandi, B. S., Vivas, A. B., Khan, I., & Lowe, R. (2023). Differential Outcomes Training of Visuospatial Memory: A Gamified Approach Using a Socially Assistive Robot. International Journal of Social Robotics [DOI]

Conference Proceedings

  • Markelius, A., Doğan, F. I., Bailey, J., Laban, G., Gibson, J. I., & Gunes, H. (2026). Social Robotics for Disabled Students: An Empirical Investigation of Embodiment, Roles and Interaction. Proceedings of ACM/IEEE Human Robot Interaction (Accepted)
  • Cheong, J.*, Doğan, F. I.*, Markelius, A.*, Cross, E. S., Eyssel, F., Castellano, G., & Gunes, H. (2026). Equitable Robotics for Wellbeing (EqRoW). Companion of ACM/IEEE Human Robot Interaction (Accepted) * Equal contribution
  • Laban, G., Hough, J., Lee, M., Markelius, A., Foster, M. E., Stuart-Smith, J., & Ahmad, M. I. (2025). Bias and Fairness in Conversational User Interfaces. Proceedings of the 7th ACM Conference on Conversational User Interfaces [DOI]
  • Markelius, A., Lou, Y., Galazka, M., Lundgren, S., Zemblys, R., Lind, H., & Lowe, R. (2025). Investigating the Mitigation of Stress in Autonomous and Non-autonomous Vehicles Using LLM Feedback. International Conference on Human-Computer Interaction
  • Markelius, A., Sjöberg, S., Lemhauori, Z., Cohen, L., Bergström, M., Lowe, R., & Cañamero, L. (2023). A Human-Robot Mutual Learning System with Affect-Grounded Language Acquisition. International Conference on Social Robotics 2023 🏆Finalist for Best Paper Award [DOI]
  • Chan, A., Salganik, R., Markelius, A., Pang, C., Rajkumar, N., Krasheninnikov, D., ... & Maharaj, T. (2023). Harms from Increasingly Agentic Algorithmic Systems. Proceedings of ACM FAccT 2023 [DOI]

Peer-Reviewed Workshop Contributions

  • Cheong, J.*, Doğan, F. I.*, Markelius, A.*, Cross, E. S., Eyssel, F., Castellano, G., & Gunes, H. (2026). Equitable Robotics for Wellbeing (EqRoW). Companion of ACM/IEEE International Conference on Human-Robot Interaction (HRI), Edinburgh, Scotland, UK. [Link] * Equal contribution
  • Brady, D., Markelius, A., Erez, T., Tanqueray, L., Lee, Y. K., & Hahn, S. (2025). Robot Learning Done Right: Responsibly Developing Foundation Models for Robotics. Workshop at Conference on Robot Learning (CoRL) & Humanoids 2025, Seoul, South Korea. [Link]
  • Laban, G., Hough, J., Lee, M., Markelius, A., Foster, M. E., Stuart-Smith, J., & Ahmad, M. I. (2025). Bias and Fairness in Conversational User Interfaces. Workshop at ACM International Conference on Conversational User Interfaces, Waterloo, Canada. [Link]
  • Markelius, A., Tanqueray, L., Lee, Y. K., Jung, Y., Lowe, R., & Larsson, S. (2024). Large Language Models in the RoMan Age: Exploring Implications on Design, Ethics and Social Impact. Workshop at IEEE International Conference on Robot and Human Interactive Communication (RO-MAN), Pasadena, US. [Link]
  • Khan, I., Markelius, A., & Lowe, R. (2023). Co-Researching with Humans-in-the-Loop: Using participatory methods, research and co-design in HRI. Workshop at International Conference on Social Robotics (ICSR), Doha, Qatar.
  • Markelius, A., Khan, I., & Lowe, R. (2023). SARCHA: Socially-Assistive Robots in Clinical and Healthcare Applications. Special Session at IEEE International Conference on Robot and Human Interactive Communication (RO-MAN), Busan, South Korea.

Talks & Press

Podcasts

  • Sangre y Suerte Podcast – The Inevitable SOCIAL ROBOTS That Are Changing the WORLD
    YouTube ↗
  • Cambridge Student Podcast – AI ethics, human rights and my work as President of Cambridge University AI Ethics Society
    Spotify ↗
  • Mindshop Knowledge Society Podcast – AI ethics, feminism, social robotics and design justice
    YouTube ↗

Invited Talks

  • KTH Royal Institute of Technology – AI Ethics for energy engineering students, Stockholm, Sweden (2024 & 2025)
  • ACII 2024 – Keynote & panellist, workshop From Lab to Life, Glasgow, Scotland (2024)
  • Raoul Wallenberg Academy Conference – AI Ethics, human rights and democracy in education, Stockholm, Sweden (2024)
  • Mindshop Knowledge Society – Cognitive science, AI and robotics seminar (2023)
  • Cambridge AI Ethics Society × CHIA – Early Career AI Ethics Workshop, Cambridge, uk (2023)
  • Centre for Human-Inspired AI (CHIA) – Social Humanoid Assistive Affective Robotics for Cognitive Interventions, Cambridge, UK (2023)
  • Sweco IT Sweden / Microsoft Share & Evolve – AI Ethics and Responsibility, Stockholm, Sweden (2023)
  • Oxbridge Robotics Summer School – Robotics and Ethics, Cambridge, UK (2023)
  • Climate Parliament, Stockholm University – AI, Climate Change and Science Fiction, Stockholm, Sweden (2018)

Panels

  • IEEE RO-MAN 2024 – Interactive AI for Human-Centered Robotics workshop, Pasadena, USA (2024)
  • EQUALS EU – Whose Digital Future? Gender, Rights, Inclusion, and Exclusion, Geneva, Switzerland (2023)
  • Nordic China Startup Forum – AI Trends, Business and Female Leadership (2022)
  • Science Festival Gothenburg – AI, Robotics and Science Fiction (2020)

Press & Features

  • EduAI book – Swedish Women in AI – Featured interview (2025)
    eduai.se ↗
  • ITV News Anglia – Interview about social robot companions and robot pets (2025)
  • Cambridge Edition – Interview with a Robot (with Furhat), Cambridge Festival (2025)
    link ↗
  • Study With Me – Eleonora Svanberg – Featured in book on mathematics and STEM (2024)
    bok.us ↗
  • #IamthefutureofAI – Interview by Women in AI Ethics (2024)
    Medium ↗
  • Dagens Industri – Interview after career stipend (Swedish, 2022)
    link ↗

In Nairobi, Kenya as a AI Ethics delegate from Cambridge
